original_text: In the present work we use the mortar finite element method for the coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity. The mortar method has been shown to preserve optimal convergence rates (see Laursen (2002) [25] for details) and is variationally consistent. We show that the method can be applied to isogeometric analysis with little effort, once the framework of NURBS based shape functions has been implemented. Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration. The excellent performance of the redesigned mortar method as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.In the present work we use the mortar finite element method for the coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity. The mortar method has been shown to preserve optimal convergence rates (see Laursen (2002) [25] for details) and is variationally consistent. We show that the method can be applied to isogeometric analysis with little effort, once the framework of NURBS based shape functions has been implemented. Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration. The excellent performance of the redesigned mortar method as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.
original_translation: En el presente trabajo utilizamos el método de elementos finitos de mortero para el acoplamiento de subdominios discretizados no conformes en el marco de la elasticidad no lineal. Se ha demostrado que el método de mortero conserva tasas de convergencia óptimas (ver Laursen (2002) [25] para más detalles) y es variacionalmente consistente. Mostramos que el método se puede aplicar al análisis isogeométrico con poco esfuerzo, una vez que se ha implementado el marco de funciones de forma basadas en NURBS. Además, una técnica específica de aumento de coordenadas permite el diseño de un esquema de energía-momento para el sistema mecánico restringido bajo consideración. El excelente rendimiento del método de mortero rediseñado, así como del esquema de energía-momento, se ilustra en ejemplos numéricos representativos.

We show that the method can be applied to isogeometric analysis with little effort, once the framework of NURBS based shape functions has been implemented.
Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration.

The excellent performance of the redesigned mortar method as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.

original_annotated_sentences:
In the present work we use the mortar finite element method for the
coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity
.
The mortar method has been shown to preserve optimal convergence rates (see Laursen (2002) [25] for details) and is variationally consistent.
We show that the method can be applied to isogeometric analysis with little effort, once the framework of NURBS based shape functions has been implemented.
Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration.

The excellent performance of the redesigned mortar method as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.In the present work we use the mortar finite element method for the

.

Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration.
The excellent performance of the redesigned mortar method as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.

mortar finite element.translated_key: método de elementos finitos de mortero
original_annotated_sentences:
In the present work we use the
mortar finite element
method for the coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity.
The mortar method has been shown to preserve optimal convergence rates (see Laursen (2002) [25] for details) and is variationally consistent.
We show that the method can be applied to isogeometric analysis with little effort, once the framework of NURBS based shape functions has been implemented.
Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration.

The excellent performance of the redesigned mortar method as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.In the present work we use the
mortar finite element
method for the coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity.
The mortar method has been shown to preserve optimal convergence rates (see Laursen (2002) [25] for details) and is variationally consistent.
We show that the method can be applied to isogeometric analysis with little effort, once the framework of NURBS based shape functions has been implemented.
Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration.
The excellent performance of the redesigned mortar method as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.

In the present work we use the
mortar finite element method
for the coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity.

The excellent performance of the redesigned mortar method as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.In the present work we use the
mortar finite element method
for the coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity.
translated_annotated_samples:
En el presente trabajo utilizamos el
método de elementos finitos de mortero
para el acoplamiento de subdominios discretizados no conformes en el marco de la elasticidad no lineal.
El excelente rendimiento del método de mortero rediseñado, así como del esquema de energía-momento, se ilustra en ejemplos numéricos representativos.
mortar finite element method.translated_text:
En el presente trabajo utilizamos el
método de elementos finitos de mortero
para el acoplamiento de subdominios discretizados no conformes en el marco de la elasticidad no lineal. Se ha demostrado que el método de mortero conserva tasas de convergencia óptimas (ver Laursen (2002) [25] para más detalles) y es variacionalmente consistente. Mostramos que el método se puede aplicar al análisis isogeométrico con poco esfuerzo, una vez que se ha implementado el marco de funciones de forma basadas en NURBS. Además, una técnica específica de aumento de coordenadas permite el diseño de un esquema de energía-momento para el sistema mecánico restringido bajo consideración. El excelente rendimiento del método de mortero rediseñado, así como del esquema de energía-momento, se ilustra en ejemplos numéricos representativos.

original_annotated_sentences: In the present work we use the mortar finite element method for the coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity.

The
mortar method
has been shown to preserve optimal convergence rates (see Laursen (2002) [25] for details) and is variationally consistent.
We show that the method can be applied to isogeometric analysis with little effort, once the framework of NURBS based shape functions has been implemented.
Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration.

The excellent performance of the redesigned
mortar method
as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.In the present work we use the mortar finite element method for the coupling of nonconforming discretized sub-domains in the framework of nonlinear elasticity.

We show that the method can be applied to isogeometric analysis with little effort, once the framework of NURBS based shape functions has been implemented.
Furthermore, a specific coordinate augmentation technique allows the design of an energy–momentum scheme for the constrained mechanical system under consideration.

The excellent performance of the redesigned
mortar method
as well as the energy–momentum scheme is illustrated in representative numerical examples.

optimal convergence rates.translated_text:
En el presente trabajo utilizamos el método de elementos finitos de mortero para el acoplamiento de subdominios discretizados no conformes en el marco de la elasticidad no lineal. Se ha demostrado que el método de mortero conserva
tasas de convergencia óptimas
(ver Laursen (2002) [25] para más detalles) y es variacionalmente consistente. Mostramos que el método se puede aplicar al análisis isogeométrico con poco esfuerzo, una vez que se ha implementado el marco de funciones de forma basadas en NURBS. Además, una técnica específica de aumento de coordenadas permite el diseño de un esquema de energía-momento para el sistema mecánico restringido bajo consideración. El excelente rendimiento del método de mortero rediseñado, así como del esquema de energía-momento, se ilustra en ejemplos numéricos representativos.
